column11: Coleman-Derr D et al. The Arabidopsis nucleosome remodeler DDM1 allows DNA methyltransferases to access H1-containing heterochromatin. Cell 2013 Mar 28;153(1):193-205. PMID: 23540698'
column13: Zemach A, Kim MY, Hsieh PH, Coleman-Derr D et al. The Arabidopsis nucleosome remodeler DDM1 allows DNA methyltransferases to access H1-containing heterochromatin. Cell 2013 Mar 28;153(1):193-205. PMID: 23540698
column16: <div onmouseover=showBox('We used Perl scripts to convert all the Cs in the reads (and in the scaffolds) to Ts
column17: and aligned the converted reads to the converted reference scaffold
column18: allowing up to two mismatches per read. 76 base reads were divided into the first 45 and the last 31 bases
column19: 100 base reads were divided in half and 50 base reads were processed as single reads. Each half of the read was aligned independently using bowtie
column20: allowing up to two mismatches. The coordinates of the two halves were subsequently correlated; the second half was discarded if it did not match the first. Single_C: We used Perl scripts to recover the original sequence of each mapped read and
column22: count the number of times it was sequenced as a C or a T. 50bp_window: We used a Perl script to calculate fractional methylation (#C/(#C+#T)) within a 50 bp sliding window for each sequence context (CG
column24: CHH). All files are in GFF format. Files contain fractional methylation data either for individual cytosines (single-c) or in 50 bp windows.'
column26: We used Perl scripts to convert all the Cs in the reads (and in the scaffolds) to Ts, and aligned the converted reads to the converted reference scaffold, allowing up to two mismatches per read. 76 base reads were divided into the first 45 and the last 31 bases, 100 base reads were divided in half and 50 base reads were processed as single reads. Each half of the read was aligned independently using bowtie, allowing up to two mismatches. The coordinates of the two halves were subsequently correlated; the second half was discarded if it did not match the first. Single_C: We used Perl scripts to recover the original sequence of each mapped read and, for each C (on either strand), count the number of times it was sequenced as a C or a T. 50bp_window: We used a Perl script to calculate fractional methylation (#C/(#C+#T)) within a 50 bp sliding window for each sequence context (CG, CHG, CHH). All files are in GFF format. Files contain fractional methylation data either for individual cytosines (single-c) or in 50 bp windows.

column16: <div onmouseover=showBox('We used Perl scripts to convert all the Cs in the reads (and in the scaffolds) to Ts
column17: and aligned the converted reads to the converted reference scaffold
column18: allowing up to two mismatches per read. 76 base reads were divided into the first 45 and the last 31 bases
column19: 100 base reads were divided in half and 50 base reads were processed as single reads. Each half of the read was aligned independently using bowtie
column20: allowing up to two mismatches. The coordinates of the two halves were subsequently correlated; the second half was discarded if it did not match the first. Single_C: We used Perl scripts to recover the original sequence of each mapped read and
column22: count the number of times it was sequenced as a C or a T. 50bp_window: We used a Perl script to calculate fractional methylation (#C/(#C+#T)) within a 50 bp sliding window for each sequence context (CG
column24: CHH). All files are in GFF format. Files contain fractional methylation data either for individual cytosines (single-c) or in 50 bp windows.'
column26: We used Perl scripts to convert all the Cs in the reads (and in the scaffolds) to Ts, and aligned the converted reads to the converted reference scaffold, allowing up to two mismatches per read. 76 base reads were divided into the first 45 and the last 31 bases, 100 base reads were divided in half and 50 base reads were processed as single reads. Each half of the read was aligned independently using bowtie, allowing up to two mismatches. The coordinates of the two halves were subsequently correlated; the second half was discarded if it did not match the first. Single_C: We used Perl scripts to recover the original sequence of each mapped read and, for each C (on either strand), count the number of times it was sequenced as a C or a T. 50bp_window: We used a Perl script to calculate fractional methylation (#C/(#C+#T)) within a 50 bp sliding window for each sequence context (CG, CHG, CHH). All files are in GFF format. Files contain fractional methylation data either for individual cytosines (single-c) or in 50 bp windows.

column16: <div onmouseover=showBox('We aligned 36-base Illumina paired ends reads to genomic DNA. To measure nucleosome occupancy
column17: we counted the number of sequenced molecules corresponding to each nucleotide of the genome. To reduce the size of the file we collapsed all adjacent positions with equal scores to one window.'

column19: We aligned 36-base Illumina paired ends reads to genomic DNA. To measure nucleosome occupancy, we counted the number of sequenced molecules corresponding to each nucleotide of the genome. To reduce the size of the file we collapsed all adjacent positions with equal scores to one window.

Cufflinks version 1.1 was used to quantify gene expression values using the following parameters: -F 0 b N library-type fr-secondstrand G TAIR10.gtf.'

this)" onmouseout="hideBox()">
